intro: Psychotria subcrocea, commonly known as the "Red-eyed" Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its striking red-colored flowers, which are often clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptical in shape, with a glossy surface and a moderate size. Psychotria subcrocea is also noted for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses reported in local communities.
